medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsened back pain and emesis with abdominal pain localized to the right upper quadrant (RUQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptons worsened since 10pm last night (14 hours prior to evaluation), with a history of chronic back pain secondary to fibromyalgia. The abdominal pain in the RUQ is reported to be more severe than previous episodes, which usually resolve without such intensity. Patient also reports dizziness and chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Fibromyalgia, chronic pain, diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN), arthritis, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and Helicobacter pylori infection.
